exec: tests["AlertId was set as a global variable"] =

request.description:
This service is able to send alerts to your specified e-mail address or a short message directly to your phone number while the alerts themselves can monitor end dates of campaigns, expiration of line items, budget, discrepancies in impressions and clicks etc.

This service creates a new alert. There are 3 different alert levels - campaign, advertiser and agency. 

NOTE: You need to specify campaign level on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts"

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "Get Advertiser" method or campaign dictionaries.

"level" correspond to numbers: 
1 - Agency
2 - Advertiser/Client
3 - Campaign

"levelItemId" depends on "level" set. 
E.g. if "level" = 1 then you have to insert AgencyId

Settings model varies by alert type.

Possible alert types:
1 - CampaignEndDate, 
2 - LineItemEndDate, 
5 - RtbLineItemBudget, 
7 - ClicksWithoutImpressions, 
8 - ImpressionsWithoutClicks 
'settings' value is a number greater or equal to 0.

For alert types: 
3 - CampaignBudget, 
4 - LineItemBudget
'settings' value is a number between 0 and 100.

For alert types:
6 - PriceHigherThanGoal 
'settings' value is an object: 
"settings": {
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time": 1
}

For alert types: 
9 - KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 
'settings' value is an object. 
"settings": {
"trackingFilter": 1, 
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time": 1
}
10 - KpiWinRateNotMeetingGoal 
'settings' value is an object for during: 
"settings": {
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time" : 1,
} 
or for compared to: 
"settings": {
"trackingFilter": 1, // only for KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"comparedTo": 1
}

Available values for TimeType: 
1 - Days
2 - Hours

Available values for ComparedTo: 
1 - Day
2 - Week
3 - Month

Available values for KpiMetric - visits: 
1 - Higher
2 - Lower
3 - Equal
4 - Increased
5 - Decreased
6 - TrackingFilter

Available values for KpiMetric - win rate: 
1 - Higher
2 - Lower
3 - Equal
4 - Increased
5 - Decreased


Tips on request body:
- Type is always a number
- Settings depend on type
- CampaignManager/campaignCoManager value "true" enables CampaignManager or CampaignCoManager to receive alers.

This method returns list of own and inherited alerts for specified client/campaign/agency.

You can filter alerts by parsing AgencyId, AdvertiserID or CampaignId in your request URL. One and only one item can be specified. E.g. both AdvertiserId and CampaignId are not allowed.

EXAMPLE: 
v1/alerts?agencyId={{AgencyId}} or v1/alerts?advertiserId={{AdvertiserId}} or
v1/alerts?campaignId={{CampaignId}}


You can retrieve AgencyId and set it as a Global variable using "Get Advertiser" method.

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "Get Advertiser" method.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

This service updates alert details or its status (using property "isEnabled").

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts/{{AlertId}}"
{{AlertId}} is taken from global variables if set, if not get it from "GET Alerts" method and insert it here without {{}}.

Body has to be the same as in "POST Alert" method. Refer to this method's documentation.

Settings model varies by alert type.
Possible alert types: 1 - CampaignEndDate, 2 - LineItemEndDate, 5 - RtbLineItemBudget, 7 - ClicksWithoutImpressions, 8 - ImpressionsWithoutClicks 'settings' value is a number greater or equal to 0.
For alert types: 3 - CampaignBudget, 4 - LineItemBudget 'settings' value is a number between 0 and 100.
For alert type 6 - PriceHigherThanGoal 'settings' value is an object: "settings": { "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time": 1 }
For alert types: 9 - KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 'settings' value is an object. "settings": { "trackingFilter": 1, "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time": 1 } 10 - KpiWinRateNotMeetingGoal 'settings' value is an object for during: "settings": { "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time" : 1, } or for compared to: "settings": { "trackingFilter": 1, // only for KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "comparedTo": 1 }
Available values for TimeType: 1 - Days 2 - Hours
Available values for ComparedTo: 1 - Day 2 - Week 3 - Month
Available values for KpiMetric - visits: 1 - Higher 2 - Lower 3 - Equal 4 - Increased 5 - Decreased 6 - TrackingFilter
Available values for KpiMetric - win rate: 1 - Higher 2 - Lower 3 - Equal 4 - Increased 5 - Decreased

To update Notification Settings, pass NotificationSettings object. To update status, pass "isEnabled": true. Both changes cannot be made in one call and need to be made separately.

This method deletes a specified alert.

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts/{{AlertId}}"
{{AlertId}} is taken from global variables if set, if not get it from "GET Alerts" method and insert it here without {{}}.

This method allows you to enable or disable alert inherited from other level.

EXAMPLE:
v1/alerts/00000/isenabled?campaignId=11111 (where 00000 is alert id and 11111 is campaign id)

This method returns a list of campaign attributes, filtered by specified CampaignId. 

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

NOTE: You can filter campaign attributes by parsing CampaignAttributeId.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

This method returns a list of values from a certain campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeIdis required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributesId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

NOTE: You can filter campaign attribute values by parsing CampaignAttributeValueId.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId, 22222 - ValueId)

This method creates a new campaign attribute, which later can be assigned to each banner in order to batch them and sort the reports data out according to the attribute values.

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method removes an existing campaign attribute.

CampaignId and Campaign Attribute Id is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "Get Campaign Attributes" method.

This method adds a new value for a campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method renames existing campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Title
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method deletes a value from campaign attribute.

CampaignId, CampaignAttributeId and ValueId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId, 22222 - ValueId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method renames an existing value on selected campaign attribute.

CampaignId, CampaignAttributeId and ValueId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId, 22222 - ValueId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method returns a default attribute value.

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/111111/Values/default
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

This method sets attribute value as default.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/1111111/Values/default
(00000 - CampaignId, 1111111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method resets attribute default value to none.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/111111/Values/default
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "Get Campaign Attributes" method.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Managers and their ID's.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Comanagers and their ID's.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Labels and Label ID's.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Advertisers and their ID's.

body.raw: List of label groups with campaign's labels. Each group can have only one selected label.

request.description:
This method returns a list of campaign landing pages. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/LandingPages/00000
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

This method returns a campaign landing page by id. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

NOTE: You can retrieve a specific landing page by parsing LandingPageId on the request url.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.
This method allows you to validate landing page url.

This method adds a new landing page for a specified campaign. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

This method updates an existing landing page for a specified campaign.

CampaignId and LandingPageId are required in your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve LandingPageId using "Get Landing Pages" method.

This method deletes an existing landing page for a specified campaign (unless it is default landing page).

NOTE: You need to parse CampaignId and LandingPageId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method. 
You can retrive LandingPageId using "Get Landing Pages" method.

body.raw:
{
  "advertiserId": 64,
  "name": "Some Campaign",
  "budget": "1.32",
  "currency": "EUR",
  "startDate": "2017-01-01T00:00:00+02:00",
  "endDate": "2020-01-01T00:00:00+02:00",
  "subType": "Display",
  "placementViewType": "Direct",
  "managerId": 12240,
  "coManagerId": 12240,
  "trafficking": "Adform",
  "supportPackage": "InHouse",
  "timeZone": "Europe/Berlin",
  "comment": "some comment",
  "purchaseOrderNumber": "12345",
  "trackingEnabled": true,
  "viewThroughTrackingEnabled": true,
  "conversionAttributionPriority": "Low",
  "crossDeviceTargetingEnabled": true,
  "commentForReporting": "some really large comment",
  "cookieLifeTime": {
    "viewHours": 168,
    "clickHours": 672,
    "recentViewSeconds": 30,
    "recentClickSeconds": 30
  },
  "visibility": {
    "firstLevelTime": 1,
    "firstLevelArea": 50,
    "secondLevelEnabled": false,
    "secondLevelTime": 1,
    "secondLevelArea": 50,
    "thirdLevelEnabled": false,
    "thirdLevelTime": 1,
    "thirdLevelArea": 50
  },
  "tracking": {
    "enabled": false,
    "viewThroughEnabled": false,
    "conversionAttributionPriority": "Low"
  },
  "adServing": {
    "method": "Impressions",
    "level": "All"
  },
  "marathon": {
    "orderNumber": "valid order number",
    "budgetNumber": "valid budget number"
  }
}

request.description: https://api.adform.com/v1/help/buyer/campaigns#!/Campaigns/put_v1_buyer_campaigns_id_brandSafety

This method updates campaign RTB settings such as budget and capping. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: v1/campaigns/00000/rtbsettings
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method or using Dictionaries.

This method returns a list of all campaigns which are under the same client as you have logged in.

You can filter campaigns by parsing these parametes on the request URL (variable types are specified in brackets):

1. Status (byte; 1 - running, 2 - pending, 3 - finished)
2. AdvertiserId
3. Type (byte; 1 - display, 2 - email, 3 affiliate, 4 - mobile, 5 - social media, 6 - mixed, 7 - non campaign, 8 - Google, 9 - Yahoo, 10 - search/non api, 11 - search/all, 12 - realtimebidding, 13 - Microsoft)
4. DateFrom (dateTime)
5. DateTo (dateTime)
6. State (byte; 1- active, 2 inactive, 3 - deleted)
7. ... (find more on http://api.adform.com/)

EXAMPLES: 
?State=1
?DateFrom=2010-10-22T23:59:00

FYI: You can use "Params" button for easier parameter management.

This method returns a list of campaigns that the user has access to at the agency level. When no filter parameters are specified, list contains of 100 active campaigns.

More information about possible query parameters: 
http://api.adform.com/v1/help/buyer/campaigns#!/Campaigns/Campaigns_GetList

This method creates a new advertising campaign.

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "GET Advertisers" method.

You can retrieve ResponsibleUserId using "GET Users" method.

This method returns a list of Advertiser's tracking campaigns.

Advertiser ID parameter is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: ?advertiserId=00000

You can retrieve Advertiser ID using "GET Advertisers" method.

FYI: You can use "Params" button for easier parameter management.

This method updates an existing advertising campaign which is identified by CampaignId.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "GET Advertisers" method.

You can retrieve UserId using "Get Users" method.

You have to provide all settings of campaign, even the ones that are not being changed.

This method returns a list of enabled features for campaigns which are under the same client as you have logged in.

EXAMPLE: You can retrieve on which agencies alerts are enabled.
This method changes campaign status from active to inactive and the other way round by parsing CampaignId in request body (can be more than 1 CampaignId).

This method returns a list of all label groups, filtered by specified CampaignId. 

CampaignId parameter is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: ?CampaignId=00000

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

FYI: You can use "Params" button for easier parameter management.

This method adds a new label for the specified campaign label group.

LabelId is required in the request body that you are parsing.

EXAMPLE: "Id": 00000

You can retrieve LabelId using "GET Labels" method.

This method returns campaign RTB settings. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: v1/campaigns/00000/rtbsettings
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method or using Dictionaries.
